data.title: International Department Central Committee of CPC
data.text:
COLOMBO, Oct. 9 -- Visiting top Chinese Communist Party official Wu Guanzheng met here Friday and held a discussion with Sri Lankan President Chandrika Kumaratunga on relations between the two countries.

During the meeting, Wu, member of the Standing Committee of the Political Bureau of the Central Committee of the Communist Party of China (CPC), said that Sri Lanka is one of the closest and friendly neighbors of China and is among those who first recognized the new China. The historic Rice and Rubber Pact signed between the two countries during the 1950's has been a much-told good story in the history of the bilateral relations.

He said that the relations between the two countries have stood the test of vicissitudes in the international arena and experienced smooth development since the establishment of the diplomatic ties forty years ago.

He added that the Chinese government has always attached great importance to the development of friendly cooperation with Sri Lanka, and is willing to make joint efforts with the Sri Lankan counterpart to further promote the all round bilateral relations.

Wu also expressed his confidence that a new chapter for the Sino-Sri Lankan friendship initiated and nurtured by old generation of leaders of the two countries will open in the current century.

For her part, President Kumaratunga said that, for a long period of time, Sri Lanka and China have endeavored to build friendly cooperation based on equality and mutual benefit and the two countries have helped and supported each other in various fields of bilateral relations and international affairs and together contributed to safeguarding the peace and stability in Asia.

She said that both sides should spare no efforts to strengthen the friendly bilateral relations and further expand cooperation in the context of drastic changes in the current world situation.

Wu, also Secretary of the CPC Central Commission for Discipline Inspection, spoke highly of the efforts made by the Sri Lankan government on achieving reconciliation and harmony among different communities and expressed his wishes for Sri Lankan people to make greater success in building their beautiful country.

Meanwhile, Kumaratunga has highly valued the achievements constantly made by the Chinese people under the leadership of the CPC on China's national reform and opening wider to the outside world, saying that the experience of China in its development has served as a successful example for the developing countries in the world.

Prior to the meeting between Wu and the president, Sri Lankan Foreign Minister Lakshman Kadirgamar paid a courtesy call to Wu at the hotel he stayed, and both sides exchanged views on the furthering of bilateral cooperation and issues of common concern.

Wu also met with Sri Lankan Opposition Leader Ranil Wickremesinghe and leader of the JVP or People's Liberation Front Somawansa Amarasinghe on Friday.

Wu arrived here Thursday on a good will visit to the country, the first leg of his four-nation tour, which will also take him to the Maldives, Indonesia and the Philippines and Indonesia.
